div.em: Current conditions as of 24 Apr 06:54 am CDT

div.span: A chance of showers, with thunderstorms also possible after 10am. Mostly cloudy, with a high near 62. Windy, with a north wind 21 to 26 mph, with gusts as high as 37 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%.
A 10 percent chance of showers before 7pm. Mostly cloudy, then gradually becoming clear, with a low around 39. Breezy, with a north wind 16 to 21 mph decreasing to 8 to 13 mph in the evening.
Mostly sunny, with a high near 67. Northwest wind 8 to 13 mph.

span.b: I want to thank the Shepherd Center Residents, the Activity Director Amy Berry & her daughter Emily, the Cimarron Community, and the High School Art Students for making the Live Facebook Art show a success.

I have always counted my blessings for such hard working and talented students. Â Itâs a joy to be part of and witness their artistic growth year after year. Thank you, students! The artist Pablo Picasso said,Â âAll children are artists. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up.âÂ I look forward to seeing what my students will create next.

Congratulations to Isabella Cardiel (1stÂ place), Ethan Marshall (2ndÂ place), & Jacey Wehkamp (3rdÂ place) for winning TheÂ Shepherd Centerâs and Communityâs vote on their top three favorite artworks.

span.i: Our elementary school library will be utilizing the schoolsâ website and Facebook page as a tool for literature information and website links for students and parents to access. Each week students will find new material for holidays, anniversaries, special days and read aloud storiesÂ to celebrate and learn.Â

a.span: Original Author of Pete the Cat,Â

div.h6: The Nuts, and Groovy Joe!Â Â Eric LitwinÂ is aÂ song singing, guitar strumming,Â # 1 New York Times Best Selling, award winning author whoÂ bringsÂ early literacy and music together.Â
div.p: He is the original author of the Pete the Cat series as well as the author ofÂ The Nuts and Groovy Joe.Â Eric believes that learning to read is both taught and joyfully experienced. And, the more fun the more learning.Â Eric's books have sold over 13Â million copies, been translated into 17Â languages, and won 26Â literacyÂ awards including aÂ TheodorÂ Geisel Seuss Honor Award. Â

span.style: color: rgb(149, 79, 114); text-decoration: underline; font-family: Verdana;

span.span: Martha Speaks is an animated series on PBS KIDS. Martha's educational goal is to teach kids new words.Â

Based on the children's book series by Susan Meddaugh and published by Houghton Mifflin Harcourt, the series stars Martha, a beloved family dog. She is accidentally fed alphabet soup â this gives her the power of speech and the chance to speak her mind to anyone that will listen.

p.span: In the small California town of Santa Vista, four eight-year-old best friends help found and maintain The Critter Club, a rescue shelter set on saving âlost and lonelyâ animals, in this sweet and silly chapter book series.

span.span: Mary Downing Hahn, a former children's librarian, is the award-winning author of many popular ghost stories. Her work has won more than fifty child-voted state awards.Â An avid reader, traveler, and all-around arts lover, Ms. Hahn lives in Columbia, Maryland.Â

Diary of a Wimpy KidÂ authorÂ Jeff KinneyÂ didn't grow up wanting to be a children's author. His dream was to become a newspaper cartoonist, but he wasn't able to get his comic strips syndicated. In 1998Â JeffÂ came up with the idea forÂ Diary of a Wimpy Kid, aÂ storyÂ about a middle-school weakling named Greg Heffley.
Gordon Kormanâs website is full of information. You can find his books, blog, readerâs forum and more! Check it out!
If sports are your thing, check out Mikeâs Podcast, latest videos, new books, and book tour information from his official website.

* April 22, 1970 was an important day for our environment. People across the nation joined together in marches and clean-up efforts dedicated to saving our planet from pollution. Earth Day 1990 opened a new commitment to reducing pollution by increasing recycling, saving energy and water, and keeping our air clean. Make it Earth Day every day..Â
Todayâs students are tomorrowâs leaders. They deserve healthy schools in which to study, learn, and grow.
*National Arbor Day (Last Friday in April) - Friday, April 24

* J. Sterling Morton, editor of Nebraska's first newspaper, encouraged people to plant trees for fuel, food, building material, and to provide windbreaks and shade. In 1872 he proposed a tree planting holiday called "Arbor Day." By 1894, Arbor Day was celebrated in every state.Â

Enclose a $1.00 shipping and handling fee. A 6' to 12" tree will be shipped between February and May or between September and November. This organization will also send a free "Celebrate Arbor Day" packet upon request.
Â The Honest To Goodness Truth by Patricia C. McKissack

div.p:
When we are anxious or upset, our heart rate increases and our breath becomes shallow.Â
When we take deep breaths, we send a message back to the brain: Itâs okay to calm down.
